thread.title: Transgender murderer moved from women’s prison ‘after having sex with female inmates’
thread.title_full: Transgender murderer moved from women’s prison ‘after having sex with female inmates’

author: Natalie Evans
title: Transgender murderer moved from women’s prison ‘after having sex with female inmates’
text:
News Transgender murderer moved from women’s prison ‘after having sex with female inmates’ Paris Green, 23, who was born male and is awaiting sex change surgery, allegedly romped with women at HMP Edinburgh Share Paris Green was reportedly removed from the female wing (Photo: Spindrift Photo Agency) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A transgender murderer has been removed from a female prison after allegedly having sex with inmates, it was reported. 
Paris Green, who was born a man but identifies as a woman, had been allowed to serve her jail term in the female wing of HMP Edinburgh. 
But the 23-year-old, who has yet to have sex change surgery, has reportedly been transferred back to the male block after she allegedly slept with female prisoners 
A source told the Daily Star Sunday : "The women want sex and Paris is the only person who can give it to them." Read More Green was housed in the female wing of HMP Edinburgh (Photo: Daily Record) She has now been moved back to the male wing (Photo: PA) 
Green, who was born Peter Laing, was previously moved from another prison amid claims of 'inappropriate behaviour' with female lags, the newspaper reported. 
She was reportedly moved from Corton Vale women’s jail, near Stirling, following alleged romps with prisoners. Read More Embarrassed prison bosses ask burglar to hand himself back in THREE WEEKS after releasing him by mistake Green was previously moved from Cornton Vale Prison for "inappropriate behaviour" (Photo: PA) 
Green and friends Kevin McDonagh and Dean Smith were jailed for at least 18 years in 2013 for torturing and murdering Robert Shankland. 
The gang lured the 46-year-old victim to a flat in Glenrothes, Fife, before beating him to death in a row over a bag of chips. 
The Scottish Ministry of Justice declined to comment on individual cases. Like us on Facebook
